EmailTemplate.subject: IGNITE 2015 - Get involved in our launch event for the NCS alumni programme on Saturday 28th of November!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hello parent or guardian of {!Contact.Name},
Whilst the National Citizen Service is over, your young person's journey is only just beginning. Now they have graduated, they are part of a huge alumni network of over 70,000 young people from across the country and have access to a huge range of exciting and development opportunities through The Challenge Society. Over the next year they will have access to careers workshops, volunteering placements, work experience opportunities and much much more!
This weekend we have our launch event where we want to bring together over 300 graduates from South East London for a day of workshops, networking sessions and training events. Check out all the upskilling and employability sessions that we have on offer, and please do encourage your young person not to miss out on this fantastic opportunity!
TICKETS ARE LIMITED SO CLICK HERE TO RESERVE A SPACE!
WORKSHOPS
Personal Statements with Goldsmiths University
CV's and Cover Letters with The Challenge
Managing Your Personal Finances with The Money Charity
Introduction to Film Making by Chocolate Films
Customer Service and Communication with The Shard
Wellbeing and Stress Management with The Museum of Happiness
Professional Social Media with The Challenge
And many more....
PROFESSIONAL NETWORKING
We have over 40 professionals from different industries coming down to take part in our networking lunch. This is a great opportunity for your young person to come and learn about potential careers!
We have professionals working in law, medicine, banking, finance, and technology.
Artists, musicians, designers, engineers, photographers, social workers, teachers, politicians...
If you are available on Saturday and want to speak to hundreds of graduates about your career - we would also love you to come along!
TRAINING SESSIONS
We are looking for NCS graduates who work with our Sales and Staffing teams!
Sales Ambassadors volunteer with our sales teams and champion the National Citizen Service programme in local schools and colleges!
Youth Assessors help us choose amazing staff for the National Citizen Service programme in 2016 at our assessment events!
Both roles look amazing on CV and UCAS applications and great at teaching skills like public speaking, presentation and facilitation skills!
If you have any questions or want to find out more about the opportunities available to your young person through The Challenge Society please either head to our website, or send me an email at tcs.southlondon@the-challenge.org!
Rhiannon - Graduate Associate Manager
